name: Where Did The Band Get Its Name? Quiz | Music | 15 Questions

questions.text: Members of this band claimed that they took the advice of a Ouija board to get the name of their band.
questions.explanation:
Cheap Trick.

	Supposedly, this is what the board spelled out.

questions.text: This band was named after a quote attributed both to Aldous Huxley and to William Blake.
questions.explanation:
The Doors.

	'The Doors of Perception' was the title of Huxley's book on drug experiences, taken from a line from a poem by Blake- 'There are things that are known and things that are unknown, and in-between, there are doors.'

questions.text: This band is named after the inventor of a piece of agricultural equipment.
questions.explanation:
Jethro Tull.

	Tull invented the seed drill, a planting device. Agrarian and rural themes are a common subject of the band's songs.

questions.text: Keith Moon of The Who advised this band that their act would go over 'like a lead balloon'. The band took this advice to heart and called themselves...
questions.explanation:
Led Zeppelin.

	They certainly proved their manager wrong!

questions.text: This band named themselves after their annoying gym teacher.
questions.explanation:
Lynyrd Skynyrd.

	Leonard Skinner was his name. I wonder if he ever knew how he'd been parodied...

questions.text: Which of the following bands is not named after a kind of candy?
questions.explanation:
Pearl Jam.

	No, I don't know exactly what kind of candy a Squirrel Nut Zipper is either...

questions.text: This band is named after a character in the book and movie "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory."
questions.explanation:
Veruca Salt.

	Veruca Salt was not a nice character, but instead was greedy and demanding.

questions.text: This band is named after a UFO-type object reported by soldiers in WWII.
questions.explanation:
Foo Fighters.

	'Foo fighters' were green fireballs that pilots could not explain.

questions.text: This band is named after an electrical inventor.
questions.explanation:
Tesla.

	Nikola Tesla did important research in alternating current, radio, fluorescent lights, X-rays, microwaves and many other fields. He was an eccentric genius.

questions.text: This band is named after a Monty Python skit.
questions.explanation:
Toad the Wet Sprocket.

	Supposedly a band, in the skit.

questions.text: This band is named after a custom of the Australian Aborigines.
questions.explanation:
Three Dog Night.

	A 'three dog night' was so cold that you needed to sleep with three dogs to keep warm.

questions.text: This band was convinced that the human race is experiencing de-evolution, thus its name.
questions.explanation:
Devo.

	As you can see, this is an abbreviation for the concept.

questions.text: This band was named after the first book of the Bible.
questions.explanation:
Genesis.

	Their first album was 'From Genesis to Revelation.'

questions.text: This band was named after a novel by Herman Hesse.
questions.explanation:
Steppenwolf.

	The story of a man who wanted to be a wolf.

questions.text: This band named itself after the members' financial conditions when they formed the band!
questions.explanation:
Dire Straits.

	One can suppose that their condition improved.
